main_en: ^Do you remember this place, sweetheart? We used to visit every year for Cemetery Day.
^Yeah… We would always bring food and incense to leave at the gravestones.
^I remember there was that one time you were in charge of making the fire for the incense, and you nearly burned the whole place down.
^[They gradually stop laughing and have a neutral, somber face to them]
^Whenever we went there, I always thought that the cemetery was a creepy place that had scary ghosts that would jumpscare me. I don’t know why, but it looks so…peaceful. It’s nice…
^Look at you, brave little one — you’re growing into a mature strong adult.
^I can't believe how much you've grown. Nearly 18! Time does fly.

^Look at what you’ve accomplished! You _________, __________, and you even helped your mom out. You’re a strong, tough cookie. I couldn’t have been more proud of you and I will always continue to be proud of you.
^You walked, you ran, you soared. You lived. That's all I ever wanted for you.
^Thank you sweetheart for accompanying me on this journey. I’m sorry I was so tough on you.
^Here, mom, these are for you. They’re your favorite flowers, and this will make your tombstone more homely.
^It's time for me to go, my darling. Remember, I'm always with you— through the good times, the bad times, and everything in between.
^Do you really have to leave now, Mom? I'll miss you so much.

^I know, sweetheart, and I’ll miss you too… You’ll always be in my heart and in my mind. Don’t ever forget that. But, you’re ready to face the world. Live fully, love deeply, be happy. That’s all I’ve ever wished for you.

s: ^Sniff* I won’t ever forget you, Mom. I promise. I’ll keep visiting, and I’ll make sure this place is never lonely.

c-0: ^I won’t be alone... I have all these memories and so many people who care for me. I’ll move forward, carrying you in my heart forever

main_fa: ^هاااااا؟ مامان توییی؟ چه شکلی ممکنه؟ یعنی من مردم؟
